properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 3 at 8:16PM PST until February 5 at 9:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
...WIND AND COLD TEMPERATURES WILL CREATE BELOW ZERO WIND CHILLS
TONIGHT AND TUESDAY NIGHT...

* WHAT...North to northeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60
mph along the coastal slopes and 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to
30 mph elsewhere. The wind, in combination with low temperatures
in the single digits, will result in wind chill readings from 0
to -10 degrees across most areas.

* WHERE...San Bernardino County Mountains

* WHEN...Until 9 AM PST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages
may result. Difficult travel at times for high profile vehicles.
Frostbite could occur on unprotected skin.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. If going outdoors for
long duration, make sure all skin is covered.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST WEDNESDAY
